thread.title: Here's Why Bank Of America Is Planning More Than 100 Layoffs BAC C - Investors.com
thread.title_full: Here's Why Bank Of America Is Planning More Than 100 Layoffs BAC C - Investors.com

author: yahoo
title: Here's Why Bank Of America Is Planning More Than 100 Layoffs BAC C - Investors.com
text:
A mid anticipated declines in its trading business , Bank of America (NYSE: BAC ) is expected to lay off more than 100 employees in its global banking and global markets units, the Wall Street Journal reported . 
Banks usually cut positions ahead of bonus season and BofA's move didn't come as a surprise given Chairman and CEO Brian Moynihan's focus on cost cutting. Moynihan has said that if the Charlotte, N.C.-based lender's trading revenues don't improve, then BofA will have to make more cuts. 
Earlier this month, Moynihan said he expected BofA's trading revenue could fall between 5% and 6%. The bank's second-quarter trading revenue slipped 2%, excluding an accounting-related adjustment.   View Enlarged Image 

Citigroup (NYSE: C ) also said it expects its Q3 trading revenue to fall 5%. 
Bank of America shares fell 0.4% to 15.41 in the stock market today , trading steadily below its 200-day moving average. 
Other banks' stocks slipped in morning trading despite the overall market being up. JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM ) stock fell 1% to 59.39, Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC ) dropped a fraction to 50.36, Citigroup fell 0.2% to 48.91, Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS ) slipped 1.6% to 170.34 and Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS ) dropped 0.6% to 30.89. 
BofA stock is down about 14% so far this year and has an IBD Composite Rating of 46 out of 99, meaning that it is being outperformed by 54% of other publicly traded companies.
